intro: Hippolytia alashanensis, commonly known as the Alashan hippolytia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
